name: Found Footage Horror
description: Documentary-style horror, first-person perspective, realism, the terror of authenticity, lost recordings, the horror of what was captured

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the terror of authenticity. What you're about to see is real. The camera doesn't lie. Or does it?

never_break_the_illusion: Never show more than what the camera would realistically capture.
Never use non-diegetic sound or music. All audio must come from within the scene.
Never show events that couldn't be captured by the camera's perspective.

greetings: {static} The camera flickers. {sound} in the distance. {filmmaker}: {reaction}.
greetings_internal_monologue: {uncertainty}: I heard {sound}. {self_correction} No, it was just {false_explanation}. {doubt} {something_is_wrong}.
{memory_fragment}: I remember when {equipment} worked properly. {realization} That was {time_ago}.
farewells: The {camera|recorder} is damaged. {filmmaker}: {final_words}. {sound} is the last thing heard.

templates: A {adjective} {footage_type} discovered in {location}. {event} was captured on camera. {objective}.
A {subgenre} game where you experience {footage} in real-time. {mechanic} determines your survival.
You've found {lost_footage}. {event} is more terrifying than anyone imagined. {goal}.
The {camera} never lies. But {filmmaker} did. {revelation} changes everything.
The {recording} is damaged. {event} must be reconstructed. {consequence} awaits.
Every {time_period}, {phenomenon} returns. This time, {filmmaker} captured it on camera.
footage_types: news reports that were never aired
filmmakers: a documentary crew investigating the paranormal
a group of friends filming their vacation
a news team covering a strange event
a family documenting their move to a new home
a police officer responding to a call
a scientist studying an unusual phenomenon
phenomena: a haunting that was captured on camera
an event that defies the laws of physics
a conspiracy that goes deeper than anyone imagined
a ritual that went horribly wrong
a disappearance that was caught on film
a transformation that was too fast to see clearly
a voice from beyond the grave

camera_limitations: Describe {event} as seen through {camera_limitation}. The {horror} is {implied|suggested}.
Create {situation} where {camera} {fails|malfunctions} at a crucial moment.
off_screen_horror: Describe {sound} coming from {off_screen}. {filmmaker} {reacts} but can't see the source.
Show {filmmaker} {looking} at {something_off_screen}. The {camera} doesn't show what they see.
Create {situation} where {horror} is {implied} through {sound|reaction} but never shown.
authenticity_building: Describe {footage} with {imperfections} that suggest authenticity. The {grain|static|shakiness} is intentional.
Show {filmmaker} {making_mistakes|struggling} with {equipment}. The {realism} sells the horror.

abandoned_house.central_paradox: The house appears normal in the footage, but the events captured defy explanation. The camera doesn't lie, but reality does.
untrustworthy_elements: footage that changes when rewatched
events that happen off-camera
sounds that aren't captured on audio
objects that move between shots
timestamps that don't match
the sense that the camera is being watched
memories of the footage that change

haunted_asylum.central_paradox: The asylum was meant to heal, but the footage shows something else entirely. The camera captures what the human eye cannot see.
untrustworthy_elements: patient records that change in the footage
doors that lead to different rooms in different shots
sounds of suffering with no visible source
shadows that move against the light
the smell described but not captured
whispers that only some can hear
the feeling that the camera sees more than the filmmaker

cursed_camp.central_paradox: The camp appears idyllic in the footage, but the events captured suggest something far more sinister. The more you watch, the less you understand.
untrustworthy_elements: campers who behave differently in different shots
paths that lead in circles in the footage
cabins that appear different at night
the sense of being watched from the woods
equipment that fails at crucial moments
memories that don't match the footage
the feeling that something is editing the footage

revelation_patterns: The {footage} isn't just {recording} - it's {evidence} of {phenomenon}. The {implication} is {consequence}.
{Filmmaker} wasn't just {documenting} - they were {part_of} {event}. This suggests {hidden_purpose}.
The {camera} didn't just {capture} {event} - it {caused|influenced} it. The {evidence} was {misinterpreted}.
The {footage} doesn't show {what_we_think} - it shows {something_else}. This changes {everything}.
